name: PlayxAnimation
desc: An object representing what animation to be played for current model.

name: autoPlay
desc:
Decides whether to play the animation automatically or not.
Default is true.

name: PlayxAnimation.byIndex
desc: creates animation object by index to be played.

name: PlayxAnimation.byName
desc: creates animation object by name to be played.

name: index
desc: The Index of the Animation to be used.

name: name
desc: The Name of the Animation to be used.

name: Camera
desc: An object that controls camera, it describes what mode it operates on, position, exposure and more.

name: exposure
desc: An object that control camera Exposure.

name: farPlane
desc: The distance to the far plane, which defaults to 5000.

name: flightMaxMoveSpeed
desc:
The maximum camera translation speed in world units per second for FREE_FLIGHT mode.
Defaults to 10.

name: flightMoveDamping
desc:
Applies a deceleration to camera movement in FREE_FLIGHT mode. Defaults to 0 (no damping).
Lower values give slower damping times. A good default is 15.0. Too high a value may lead to instability.

name: flightSpeedSteps
desc:
The number of speed steps adjustable with scroll wheel for FREE_FLIGHT mode.
Defaults to 80.

name: flightStartOrientation
desc:
The initial orientation in pitch and yaw for FREE_FLIGHT mode.
Defaults to 0,0.

name: flightStartPosition
desc:
The initial eye position in world space for FREE_FLIGHT mode.
Defaults to (x:0,y:0,z:0).

name: fovDegrees
desc:
The full FOV (not the half-angle) in the degrees.
This defaults to 33.

name: fovDirection
desc:
The FOV axis that's held constant when the viewport changes.
This defaults to Vertical.

name: Camera.freeFlight
desc: Creates a camera on free flight mode.

name: groundPlane
desc: The ground plane equation used for ray casts. This is a plane equation as in Ax + By + Cz + D = 0. Defaults to (0, 0, 1, 0).

name: lensProjection
desc: An object that control camera and set it's projection matrix from the focal length.

name: Camera.map
desc: Creates a camera on map mode.

name: mapExtent
desc:
The ground plane size used to compute the home position for MAP mode.
This defaults to 512 x 512

name: mapMinDistance
desc: Constrains the zoom-in level. Defaults to 0.

name: Camera.orbit
desc: Creates a camera on orbit mode.

name: orbitHomePosition
desc:
The initial eye position in world space for ORBIT mode.
This defaults to (x:0,y:0,z:1).

name: orbitSpeed
desc:
Sets the multiplier with viewport delta for ORBIT mode.This defaults to 0.01
List of 2 double :x,y

name: projection
desc: An object that controls camera projection matrix.

name: scaling
desc:
Sets an additional matrix that scales the projection matrix.
This is useful to adjust the aspect ratio of the camera independent from its projection.
Its sent as List of 2 double elements :
* xscaling  horizontal scaling to be applied after the projection matrix.

name: shift
desc:
Sets an additional matrix that shifts (translates) the projection matrix.
The shift parameters are specified in NDC coordinates.
Its sent as List of 2 double elements :
*  xshift    horizontal shift in NDC coordinates applied after the projection
*  yshift    vertical shift in NDC coordinates applied after the projection

name: targetPosition
desc: The world-space position of interest, which defaults to (x:0,y:0,z:-4).

name: upVector
desc: The orientation for the home position, which defaults to (x:0,y:1,z:0).

name: zoomSpeed
desc: The scroll delta multiplier, which defaults to 0.01.

name: Mode
desc:
Camera Modes that operates on.
Three modes are supported: ORBIT, MAP, and FREE_FLIGHT.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: ColoredSkybox
desc: An object that represents skybox based that shows a color only.

name: Cube
desc: An object that represents a cube shape to be rendered.

name: length
desc: Length of the cube.

name: DefaultIndirectLight
desc:
An object that represents indirect light based on given parameters like:
Irradiance
The irradiance represents the light that comes from the environment and shines an object's surface.
The irradiance is calculated automatically from the Reflections (see below), and generally doesn't need to be provided explicitly.
However, it can be provided separately from the Reflections as Spherical Harmonics  (SH) of 1, 2 or 3 bands, respectively 1, 4 or 9 coefficients.

name: irradianceBands
desc: irradiance Bands: Number of spherical harmonics bands. Must be 1, 2 or 3.

name: irradianceSh
desc:
irradiance sh –  Array containing the spherical harmonics coefficients.
The size of the array must be 3 × bands2 (i.e. 1, 4 or 9 float3 coefficients respectively).
Sets the irradiance as Spherical Harmonics.

name: radianceBands
desc: radiance Bands: Number of spherical harmonics bands. Must be 1, 2 or 3.

name: radianceSh
desc:
radianceSh – Array containing the spherical harmonics coefficients.
The size of the array must be 3 × bands2 (i.e. 1, 4 or 9 float3 coefficients respectively).
Sets the irradiance from the radiance expressed as Spherical Harmonics.

name: rotation
desc:
rotation – 3x3 rotation matrix. Must be a rigid-body transform.
Specifies the rigid-body transformation to apply to the IBL.

name: PlayxDirection
desc: An object that represents the direction of the shape in the world space.

name: Exposure
desc:
An object that control camera Exposure.
The exposure ultimately controls the scene's brightness,
just like with a real camera. The default values provide adequate exposure for a camera
placed outdoors on a sunny day with the sun at the zenith. With the default parameters,
the scene must contain at least one Light of intensity similar to the sun
(e.g.: a 100,000 lux directional light) and/or an indirect light of appropriate intensity (30,000).
Default is f/16, 1/125s, 100 ISO

name: aperture
desc:
Aperture in f-stops, clamped between 0.5 and 64. A lower aperture value increases the exposure,
leading to a brighter scene. Realistic values are between 0.95 and 32.

name: exposure
desc: Sets this camera's exposure directly.

name: Exposure.formAperture
desc: Sets this camera's exposure (default is f/16, 1/125s, 100 ISO)

name: Exposure.formExposure
desc:
Sets this camera's exposure directly. Calling this method will set the aperture to 1.0,
the shutter speed to 1.2 and the sensitivity will be computed to match the requested exposure
(for a desired exposure of 1.0, the sensitivity will be set to 100 ISO).
This method is useful when trying to match the lighting of other engines or tools.
Many engines/tools use unit-less light intensities,
which can be matched by setting the exposure manually.
This can be typically achieved by setting the exposure to 1.0.

name: sensitivity
desc:
Sensitivity in ISO, clamped between 10 and 204,800.
A higher sensitivity increases the exposure. Realistic values are between 50 and 25600.

name: shutterSpeed
desc:
shutterSpeed – Shutter speed in seconds,
clamped between 1/25,000 and 60. A lower shutter speed increases the exposure.
Realistic values are between 1/8000 and 30. sensitivity

name: Fov
desc: Denotes a field-of-view direction.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: GlbModel
desc: represents object of model that will be loaded from glb file.

name: GlbModel.asset
desc: creates glb model based on glb file asset path.

name: GlbModel.url
desc: creates glb model based on glb file url.

name: GltfModel
desc: represents object of model that will be loaded from gltf file.

name: GltfModel.asset
desc: creates gltf model based on the  file asset path.

name: postfix
desc: postfix path for gltf image assets to be added after image path.

name: prefix
desc: Prefix path for gltf image assets to be added before image path.

name: GltfModel.url
desc:
creates gltf model based on glb file url .
currently supporting only .zip file format.

name: Ground
desc: An object that represents ground plane to be drawn on the scene.

name: height
desc: height of the ground plane.

name: isBelowModel
desc: Whether the ground plane should be drawn below the model or not.

name: width
desc: width of the ground plane.

name: HdrIndirectLight
desc: An object that represents indirect light that is created from hdr file format.

name: HdrIndirectLight.asset
desc: creates a new indirect light from HDR file format from assets.

name: HdrIndirectLight.url
desc: creates a new indirect light from HDR file format from url.

name: HdrSkybox
desc: An object that represents skybox that will be loaded from hdr file.

name: HdrSkybox.asset
desc: creates skybox object from hdr file from assets.

name: showSun
desc:
Indicates whether the sun should be rendered. The sun can only be rendered
if there is at least one light of type LightType.SUN in the Scene.
The default value is false.

name: HdrSkybox.url
desc: creates skybox object from hdr file from url.

name: IndirectLight
desc:
An object that represents Indirect Light which is used to simulate environment lighting, a form of global illumination.
Filament supports rendering with image-based lighting, or IBL.
This uses an environment map to approximate the lighting all directions.
Environment lighting has a two components:
irradiance  -  reflections (specular component)
Environments are usually captured as high-resolution HDR equirectangular images
and processed by the cmgen tool to generate the data needed by IndirectLight.
Currently IndirectLight is intended to be used for "distant probes",
that is, to represent global illumination from a distant (i.e. at infinity) environment,
such as the sky or distant mountains.
Only a single IndirectLight can be used in a Scene. This limitation will be lifted in the future.
Use the cmgen tool to generate the Spherical Harmonics for a given environment.

name: assetPath
desc:
light asset path used to load KTX FILE from assets.
used to change indirect lighting from Image-Based Light.

name: intensity
desc:
indirect light intensity.
can be used with light asset path.
or create default light with certain intensity.

name: url
desc:
light url used to load KTX FILE from assets.
used to change indirect lighting from Image-Based Light.

name: KtxIndirectLight
desc: An object that represents indirect light that is created from ktx file format.

name: KtxIndirectLight.asset
desc: creates a new indirect light from ktx file format from assets.

name: KtxIndirectLight.url
desc: creates a new indirect light from ktx file format from url.

name: KtxSkybox
desc:
An object that represents skybox that will be loaded from ktx file.
Filament supports rendering with image-based lighting, or IBL.
This uses an environment map to approximate the lighting all directions.
the Skybox object can be loaded from a KTX that does contain visible images.
Filament provides an offline tool called cmgen that can consume an equirectangular image and produce these two files in one fell swoop.

name: KtxSkybox.asset
desc: Creates skybox object from ktx file from assets.

name: KtxSkybox.url
desc: Creates skybox object from ktx file from url.

name: LensProjection
desc: An object that control camera and set it's projection matrix from the focal length.

name: aspect
desc: aspect ratio width/height.

name: far
desc:
distance in world units from the camera to the far plane.
The far plane's position in view space is z = -far.
Precondition: far > near for ProjectionType.PERSPECTIVE or far != near for ProjectionType.ORTHO.

name: focalLength
desc: lens's focal length in millimeters.

name: near
desc:
distance in world units from the camera to the near plane.
The near plane's position in view space is z = -near.
Precondition: near > 0 for ProjectionType.PERSPECTIVE or near != far for ProjectionType.ORTHO.

name: Light
desc:
An object that allows you to create a light source in the scene, such as a sun or street lights.
Light types - Lights come in three flavors:

name: castLight
desc: Whether this light casts light (enabled by default)

name: castShadows
desc:
Enables or disables casting shadows from this Light.
(disabled by default)

name: color
desc:
Sets the initial color of a light.
The light color is specified in the linear sRGB color-space.
The default is white.

name: colorTemperature
desc:
instead of passing color directly, you can pass the temperature, in Kelvin.
Converts a correlated color temperature to a  RGB color in sRGB space.
The temperature must be expressed in Kelvin and must be in the range 1,000K to 15,000K.
only one of temperature or color should be specified.

name: direction
desc:
Sets the initial direction of a light in world space.
The light direction is specified in world space and should be a unit vector.
note: The Light's direction is ignored for LightManager.Type.POINT lights.
Must be a list of 3 numbers:

name: falloffRadius
desc:
Set the falloff distance for point lights and spot lights.
At the falloff distance, the light has no more effect on objects.
The falloff distance essentially defines a sphere of influence around the light,
and therefore has an impact on performance.
Larger falloffs might reduce performance significantly,especially when many lights are used.
Try to avoid having a large number of light's spheres of influence overlap.
The Light's falloff is ignored for directional lights (LightType.DIRECTIONAL or LightType.SUN)
falloffRadius – Falloff distance in world units. Default is 1 meter.

name: intensity
desc:
Sets the initial intensity of a light.
This parameter depends on the LightType.
For directional lights,it specifies the illuminance in lux (or lumen/m^2).
For point lights and spot lights, it specifies the luminous power in lumen.

name: position
desc:
Sets the initial position of the light in world space.
note: The Light's position is ignored for directional lights (LightManager.Type.DIRECTIONAL or LightManager.Type.SUN)
Must be a list of 3 numbers:
x – Light's position x coordinate in world space. The default is 0.
y – Light's position y coordinate in world space. The default is 0.
z – Light's position z coordinate in world space. The default is 0.

name: spotLightConeInner
desc:
Defines a spot light's angular falloff attenuation.
A spot light is defined by a position, a direction and two cones, inner and outer.
These two cones are used to define the angular falloff attenuation of the spot light
and are defined by the angle from the center axis to where the falloff begins
(i.e. cones are defined by their half-angle).
note: The spot light cone is ignored for directional and point lights.
inner cone angle in radian between 0 and pi/2 outer

name: spotLightConeOuter
desc:
Defines a spot light's angular falloff attenuation.
A spot light is defined by a position, a direction and two cones, inner and outer.
These two cones are used to define the angular falloff attenuation of the spot light
and are defined by the angle from the center axis to where the falloff begins
(i.e. cones are defined by their half-angle).
note: The spot light cone is ignored for directional and point lights.
outer cone angle in radian between inner and pi/2

name: sunAngularRadius
desc:
Defines the angular radius of the sun, in degrees, between 0.25° and 20.0°
The Sun as seen from Earth has an angular size of 0.526° to 0.545°
sunAngularRadius – sun's radius in degree. Default is 0.545°.

name: sunHaloFalloff
desc:
Defines the halo falloff of the sun. The falloff is a dimensionless number used as an exponent.
haloFalloff – halo falloff. Default is 80.0.

name: sunHaloSize
desc:
Defines the halo radius of the sun. The radius of the halo is defined as a multiplier of the sun angular radius.
sunHaloSize – radius multiplier. Default is 10.0.

name: type
desc: Denotes the type of the light being created.

name: LightType
desc: Type of the direct that will be used in the scene.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: MagFilter
desc: Magnification filter to be used.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: PlayxMaterial
desc:
An object that defines the visual appearance of a surface.
Filament offers a customizable material system
that you can use to create both simple and complex materials.
Materials are defined in a .mat file that describes all the information required by a material.
To use the .mat file in the app, Use matc tool in filament to convert .mat files to .filmat files.
For more information about materials, see the filament material documentation

name: PlayxMaterial.asset
desc: Creates material object from the .filmat material file from assets

name: assetPath
desc: Asset path of the .filmat material file

name: parameters
desc: Material parameters that can be used.

name: PlayxMaterial.url
desc: Creates material object from the .filmat material file from url.

name: url
desc: url of the .filmat material file

name: MaterialParameter
desc: An object that represents material parameters that are defined in the .mat file.

name: MaterialParameter.baseColor
desc: create a material parameter of color type with baseColor parameter name.

name: MaterialParameter.bool
desc: create a material parameter of bool type.

name: MaterialParameter.boolVector
desc:
create a material parameter of bool vector type.
It takes list of max 4 bool elements as parameter.

name: MaterialParameter.color
desc: create a material parameter of color type.

name: MaterialParameter.float
desc: create a material parameter of float type.

name: MaterialParameter.floatVector
desc:
create a material parameter of float Vector type.
It takes list of max 4 double elements as parameter.

name: MaterialParameter.int
desc: create a material parameter of int type.

name: MaterialParameter.intVector
desc:
create a material parameter of int vector type.
It takes list of max 4 int elements as parameter.

name: MaterialParameter.mat3
desc:
create a material parameter of 3x3 matrix type.
It takes list of 9 double elements as parameter.

name: MaterialParameter.mat4
desc:
create a material parameter of 4x4 matrix type.
It takes list of 16 double elements as parameter.

name: MaterialParameter.metallic
desc: create a material parameter of float type with metallic parameter name.

name: name
desc: Name of the material parameter defined in the .mat file

name: MaterialParameter.roughness
desc: create a material parameter of float type with roughness parameter name.

name: MaterialParameter.texture
desc: create a material parameter of texture type.

name: type
desc: type of the material parameter.

name: value
desc: value of the material parameter.

name: MaterialType
desc:
material types base on filamant general parameters.
See also:

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: MinFilter
desc: Minification filter to be used.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: Model
desc: represents base object of the 3d model to be rendered.

name: animation
desc: Controls what animation should be played by the rendered model.

name: assetPath
desc: Model asset path to load the model from assets.

name: centerPosition
desc: Coordinate of center point position of the rendered model.

name: fallback
desc: Model to be shown when error happened.

name: scale
desc:
Scale Factor of the model.
Should be greater than 0.
Defaults to 1.

name: url
desc: Model url to load the model from url.

name: ModelState
desc: Represents the state of the model.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: Plane
desc: An object that represents a plane shape to be rendered.

name: size
desc:
size of the plane in the world space.
provides the width and height of the plane in the world space.
should provide only 2 coordinates of the plane.
To draw horizontally y must be 0.
To draw vertically z must be 0.

name: createState
desc: Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

name: gestureRecognizers
desc: Which gestures should be consumed by the view.

name: model
desc:
Model to be rendered.
provide details about the model to be rendered.
like asset path, url, animation, etc.

name: onCreated
desc:
onCreated callback provides an object of Playx3dSceneController when the native view is created.
This controller provides utility methods to update the viewer, change the animation environment, lightening, etc.
The onCreated callback is called once when the native view is created and provide unique controller to each widget.
See also:
Playx3dSceneController

name: onEachRender
desc:
onEachRenderCallback callback that is called on each frame render.
it also provides last frame render time in nanoseconds.

name: onModelStateChanged
desc:
onModelStateChanged callback provides current state of the model
whether is none, loading, loaded, fallback loaded ,error.
See Also:
ModelState

name: onSceneStateChanged
desc:
onSceneStateChanged callback provides current state of the scene;
whether is none, loading, loaded ,error.
See Also:
SceneState

name: onShapeStateChanged
desc:
onShapeStateChanged callback provides current state of the shape;
whether is none, loading, loaded ,error.
See Also:
ShapeState

name: scene
desc:
Scene to be rendered.
provide details about the scene to be rendered.
like skybox, light, camera, etc.
Default scene is a transparent Skybox with default Light and default IndirectLight
with default Camera and no Ground

name: shapes
desc:
List of shapes to be rendered.
could be plane cube or sphere.
each shape will be rendered with its own position size and material.
See also:
Shape
Cube
Sphere
Plane

name: build
desc: Describes the part of the user interface represented by this widget.

name: dispose
desc: Called when this object is removed from the tree permanently.

name: initState
desc: Called when this object is inserted into the tree.

name: Playx3dSceneController
desc:
An object which helps facilitate communication between the Playx3dScene Widget
and android side model viewer based on Filament.
It provides utility methods to update the viewer, change the animation environment, lightening, etc.
Each controller is unique for each widget.

name: addShape
desc:
Add a shape to the scene.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: beginCameraGrab
desc:
Starts a grabbing session (i.e. the user is dragging around in the viewport).
In MAP mode, this starts a panning session. In ORBIT mode, this starts either rotating or strafing.
In FREE_FLIGHT mode, this starts a nodal panning session.
x – X-coordinate for point of interest in viewport space.
y – Y-coordinate for point of interest in viewport space.
strafe – ORBIT mode only; if true, starts a translation rather than a rotation.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeAnimationByIndex
desc:
Updates the current animation by index.
Returns  the updated animation index.

name: changeAnimationByName
desc:
Updates the current animation by animation name.
Returns  the updated animation index.

name: changeIndirectLightByDefaultIndirectLight
desc:
Updates scene indirect light by DefaultIndirectLight.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeIndirectLightByHdrAsset
desc:
Updates scene indirect light by HDR file from assets.
also update scene indirect light intensity if provided.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeIndirectLightByHdrUrl
desc:
Updates scene indirect light by HDR file from assets.
also update scene indirect light intensity if provided.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeIndirectLightByKtxAsset
desc:
Updates scene indirect light by ktx file from assets.
also update scene indirect light intensity if provided.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeIndirectLightByKtxUrl
desc:
Updates scene indirect light by ktx file from url.
also update scene indirect light intensity if provided.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeModelCenterPosition
desc:
Updates current model center position in the world space.
By taking x,y,z coordinates of centerPosition in the world space.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeModelScale
desc:
Updates current model scale.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeSceneLight
desc:
Updates scene direct light .
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeSkyboxByHdrAsset
desc:
Updates skybox by hdr file from the assets.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeSkyboxByHdrUrl
desc:
Updates skybox by hdr file from url.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeSkyboxByKtxAsset
desc:
Updates skybox by ktx file from the assets.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeSkyboxByKtxUrl
desc:
Updates skybox by ktx file from url.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeSkyboxColor
desc:
Updates skybox by given color.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeToDefaultIndirectLight
desc: Updates scene indirect light to DefaultIndirectLight with default values of :

name: changeToDefaultLight
desc:
Updates scene direct light To the default value.
With intensity value of 100_000.0.
and color temperature bands of 6_500.0,
and direction of 0.0, -1.0, 0.0,
and cast shadows true.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: changeToTransparentSkybox
desc:
Updates skybox to be transparent.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: endCameraGrab
desc:
Ends a grabbing session.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: getAnimationCount
desc: Get current model animation count.

name: getAnimationNameByIndex
desc: Get Animation name by given index.

name: getAnimationNames
desc:
Get current model animation names.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: getCameraLookAtPositions
desc:
Gets the current positions the camera is looking at.
Returns List of 9 elements.
From 0:2 elements are eye position.
From 3:5 elements are target position.
From 6:8  elements are upward position

name: getCameraRayCast
desc: Given a viewport coordinate, picks a point in the ground plane.

name: getCurrentAnimationIndex
desc: Get current animation index.

name: getCurrentModelState
desc: Get current model state.

name: getCurrentShapesIds
desc: Gets current created shapes ids.

name: loadGlbModelFromAssets
desc:
Load glb model from assets and replace current model with it.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: loadGlbModelFromUrl
desc:
Load glb model from url and replace current model with it.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: loadGltfModelFromAssets
desc:
Load gltf model from assets and replace current model with it.
If the images path that in the gltf file different from the flutter asset path,
consider adding prefix to the images path to be before the image.
Or postfix to the images path to be after the image.
For example if in the gltf file, the image path is textures/texture
and in assets the image path is assets/models/textures/texture.png
prefix must be 'assets/models/' and postfix should be '.png'.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: lookAtCameraPosition
desc: Sets the camera's model matrix.

name: lookAtDefaultCameraPosition
desc:
Makes the camera looks at its default position.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: removeShape
desc:
Removes a shape from the scene by given id.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: scrollCameraTo
desc:
In MAP and ORBIT modes, dollys the camera along the viewing direction.
In FREE_FLIGHT mode, adjusts the move speed of the camera.

name: setDefaultCamera
desc:
Update the current camera to it's default settings.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateCamera
desc:
Replace current camera with a new camera.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateCameraGrab
desc:
Updates a grabbing session. This must be called at least once between beginCameraGrab / endCameraGrab to dirty the camera.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateCameraScaling
desc:
Update the current camera scaling.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateCameraShift
desc:
Update the current camera shifting.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateExposure
desc:
Update the current camera exposure.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateGround
desc:
Updates current Ground by updating it's width, height, and whether is below model or not without updating material.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateGroundMaterial
desc:
Updates current Ground material.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateLensProjection
desc:
Update the current camera lens projection.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateProjection
desc:
Update the current camera projection.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: updateShape
desc:
Updates a shape with given id with new shape.
if no shape was found with the given id, new shape will be created.
Returns String message that it's succeeded.

name: PlayxPosition
desc:
An object that represents position information as coordinates in the 3d world space.
By providing x, y and z coordinates.

name: Projection
desc: An object that controls camera projection matrix.

name: aspect
desc: aspect ratio width/height. aspect > 0

name: bottom
desc: distance in world units from the camera to the bottom plane, at the near plane. Precondition: bottom != top

name: far
desc:
distance in world units from the camera to the far plane.
The far plane's position in view space is z = -far.
Precondition: far > near for ProjectionType.PERSPECTIVE or far != near for ProjectionType.ORTHO.

name: fovDirection
desc: direction of the field-of-view parameter.

name: fovInDegrees
desc: full field-of-view in degrees. 0 < fovInDegrees < 180

name: Projection.fromFov
desc: Sets the projection matrix from the field-of-view.

name: Projection.fromPlanes
desc: Sets the projection matrix from a frustum defined by six planes.

name: left
desc: distance in world units from the camera to the left plane, at the near plane. Precondition: left != right

name: near
desc:
distance in world units from the camera to the near plane.
The near plane's position in view space is z = -near.
Precondition: near > 0 for ProjectionType.PERSPECTIVE or near != far for ProjectionType.ORTHO.

name: projection
desc: Denotes the projection type used by this camera.

name: right
desc: distance in world units from the camera to the right plane, at the near plane. Precondition: left != right

name: top
desc: distance in world units from the camera to the top plane, at the near plane. Precondition: bottom != top

name: ProjectionType
desc: Denotes the projection type used by this camera.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: Result
desc: Wrapper class to hold data on success or message on failure

name: Scene
desc: An object that represents the scene to  be rendered with information about light, skybox and more.

name: SceneState
desc: Represents the state of the scene.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: Shape
desc: An object that represents shapes to be rendered on the scene.

name: centerPosition
desc: center position of the shape in the world space.

name: id
desc: id of the shape to be used to update shapes.

name: material
desc: material to be used for the shape.

name: normal
desc: direction of the shape rotation in the world space

name: ShapeState
desc: Represents the state of loading shapes.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: PlayxSize
desc: An object that represents shape size in the world space.

name: Skybox
desc: An object that represents the skybox to be rendered in the scene.

name: assetPath
desc:
environment asset path used to load KTX FILE from assets.
changes scene skybox from images converted to KTX FILE.
Filament provides an offline tool called cmgen
that can consume an image
and produce Light and skybox ktx files in one fell swoop.

name: color
desc:
Environment Color.
Changes the background color for the scene.
if not provided and environment asset path is not provided,
A Transparent color will be used.

name: url
desc: environment url used to load KTX FILE from web.

name: Sphere
desc: An object that represents a cube shape to be rendered.

name: radius
desc: The radius of the constructed sphere.

name: slices
desc: The number of slices for the sphere.

name: stacks
desc: The number of stacks for the sphere.

name: PlayxTexture
desc: An object represents textures to be loaded by the material.

name: assetPath
desc: asset path of the texture.

name: type
desc: type of the texture.

name: url
desc: url of the texture.

name: PlayxTextureSampler
desc: An object that defines how a texture is accessed.

name: anisotropy
desc: Amount of anisotropy, controls anisotropic filtering, should be a power-of-two. The default is 0. The maximum permissible value is 7.

name: mag
desc:
Magnification filter to be used.
Defaults to LINEAR

name: min
desc:
Minification filter to be used.
Defaults to LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR

name: wrap
desc:
Wrap mode to be used
Defaults to REPEAT

name: TextureType
desc:
Type of the texture to be used
Color is the only type of texture we want to pre-multiply with the alpha channel
Pre-multiplication is the default behavior, so we need to turn it off  based on the type.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.

name: ColorsExt
desc: convert color to hex string

name: WrapMode
desc: Wrap Mode to be used.

name: values
desc: A constant List of the values in this enum, in order of their declaration.
